citation.article-title: Classification of Lactobacillus divergens, Lactobacillus piscicola, and some catalase-negative asporogenous, rod-shaped bacteria from poultry in a new genus, Carnobacterium.

p.s: Description of Carnobacterium gallinarum sp. nov.
Carnobacterium gallinarum (gal.li.na'rum. L. fem. n. gallina, a hen; L. fem. gen. pl. n. gallinarum, of hens).
Gram-positive, nonsporeforming, straight, slender rods which occur singly or in short chains.
Cells are nonmotile.
Colonies are white, convex, shiny, and circular.
Growth occurs at 0 and 35°C but not at 40°C.
Facultatively anaerobic.
L-(+)-Lactic acid is produced.
No gas is produced from glucose.

Acid is produced from amygdalin, cellobiose, D-fructose, galactose, β-gentiobiose, gluconate, D-glucose, lactose, maltose, D-mannose, melezitose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, D-ribose, salicin, sucrose, D-tagatose, D-turanose, trehalose, and D-xylose.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, glycogen, inositol, inulin, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, D-lyxose, mannitol, melibiose, α-methyl-D-mannoside, β-methyl-D-xyloside, raffinose, L-rhamnose, sorbitol, L-sorbose, xylitol, and L-xylose.
Acid from amidon variable.
All strains hydrolyze esculin and are arginine dihydrolase and β-galactosidase positive.
All strains are lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan desaminase, and urease negative.
Indole and H2S are not produced.
Voges-Proskauer positive.
The cell wall peptidoglycan contains mess-diaminopimelic acid.
The cellular fatty acids are of the straight-chain saturated and monounsaturated types with tetradecanoic, hexadecanoic, and 9,lO-octadecenoic acids predominating.
The G+C content of DNA ranges from 34.3 to 36.4 mol% (Tm).
Isolated from ice slush from around chicken carcasses.
The type strain is NCFB 2766T (MT44).
The description of the type strain corresponds to that of the species, except that acid is not produced from amidon.
